CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1953, page 20, reads: "Hill City Can Dance - The Hill City Welfare Department held its annual 'Can Dance' on Friday, Nov. 20, and were entertained by Ray Fry's combo, currently appearing at Stanley's Lounge. Members of the Welfare Department are Lorraine Spears, senior adviser; Ruby Thomas, director; Christine Brundage, superintendent of foods, and Shirley Mason, Lois Kirkland, Rosemarie Lover, Mary Strothers, Priscilla Ward, Patricia Williams, Audrey Dixon, Lorraine Pearson, Shirley Smith, Delores Blair and Shirley Murphy. Ray Fry's combo members are Ray Fry, singer; Martin Kimes, guitarist, and Johnnie Morgan, pianist. - Harris Photo."Posters read: "The Life You Save May Not Always Be Yours. one May Loose His Life Trying To Save Yours," "Sop Consider Value Your Friends...," and "Be Nice To Animals They Are Not As Dumb As You Think They Are They Make Nice Pets, Do Tricks, Save Lives!"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of men, women, and girls, including: Lorraine Spears, Ruby Thomas, Christine Brundage, Shirley Mason, Lois Kirkland, Rosemarie Lover, Mary Strothers, Priscilla Ward, Patricia Williams, Audrey Dixon, Lorraine Pearson, Shirley Smith, Delores Blair, Shirley Murphy, Ray Fry, Martin Kimes, and Johnnie Morgan, gathered around table with canned goods for food drive in the Hill City Municipal Building, another version
